question: [File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_cetus_position_value()] [Oracle Front-running] Can an attacker observe pending oracle updates and front-run update_cetus_position_value to exploit temporary price discrepancies? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_cetus_position_value()] [Multi-block Manipulation] Can an attacker manipulate prices across multiple blocks/epochs to gradually bypass slippage checks while extracting value? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: sqrt_price_x64_to_price()] [Rounding Attack] Can an attacker exploit rounding in decimal conversions to systematically inflate or deflate position values over many updates? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_cetus_position_value()] [Price Feed Delay] If oracle prices lag behind pool prices due to update frequency, can this be exploited to pass slippage checks during volatile markets? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_cetus_position_value()] [Cross-pool Attack] Can an attacker manipulate prices in one Cetus pool to affect valuation of positions in another pool via shared oracle prices? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: update_cetus_position_value()] [Griefing Attack] Can a malicious user repeatedly call this function with different valid parameters to consume gas and DoS legitimate vault operations? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_cetus_position_value()] [Decimal Manipulation] Can tokens with non-standard decimals (0, 1, or >18) cause calculation errors that pass slippage checks but return incorrect values? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_cetus_position_value()] [Extreme Price Ratios] When price_a/price_b ratio is extremely large or small (e.g., 1e30 or 1e-30), can this cause overflow/underflow in relative_price_from_oracle calculation? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_cetus_position_value()] [Edge Case] If pool has zero liquidity (newly created), can current_sqrt_price() return 0 causing sqrt_price_x64_to_price to return 0 and bypass slippage check? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_cetus_position_value()] [Edge Case] When amount_a or amount_b is 0 (concentrated liquidity out of range), does value calculation correctly handle single-sided positions? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: sqrt_price_x64_to_price()] [Edge Case] Can sqrt_price_x64 = 1 (minimum non-zero value) cause precision loss in subsequent calculations leading to incorrect price? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: sqrt_price_x64_to_price()] [Edge Case] When decimals_a = decimals_b = 0, does the function handle this correctly or cause unexpected behavior? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_cetus_position_value()] [Edge Case] If oracle returns price_a = price_b = 1e18 (both $1), can this cause relative_price_from_oracle = 1e18 and affect slippage check sensitivity? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_cetus_position_value()] [Precision] When both amounts are very small (e.g., 1 unit each), can precision loss in mul_with_oracle_price result in 0 value incorrectly? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_cetus_position_value()] [Precision] When pool_price â‰ˆ relative_price_from_oracle (within 1 wei), can integer arithmetic cause the diff to be 0, always passing slippage check? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: sqrt_price_x64_to_price()] [Precision] After squaring sqrt_price and dividing by DECIMAL, can the result lose significant precision affecting price comparison accuracy? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: update_cetus_position_value()] [Access Control] Since this is a public function, can any external caller update position values to manipulate vault state without proper authorization? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_cetus_position_value()] [Access Control] Is calculate_cetus_position_value intended to be public, allowing anyone to query position values and potentially extract sensitive information? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Integration] Does the vault module properly gate update_cetus_position_value calls to only authorized operators, or can the public visibility be exploited? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: update_cetus_position_value()] [Access Control] Can an attacker call this function during sensitive vault operations (e.g., mid-withdrawal) to manipulate value calculations? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: update_cetus_position_value()] [Race Condition] Can parallel calls to update_cetus_position_value for different positions cause inconsistent vault state if not properly ordered? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_cetus_position_value()] [Atomicity] Is the entire calculation atomic, or can pool state change between get_position_amounts and price calculations? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: update_cetus_position_value()] [Timestamp] Can clock.timestamp_ms() be stale or manipulated (e.g., via consensus attacks) to bypass time-based checks in finish_update_asset_value? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_cetus_position_value()] [State Mutation] Does passing &mut Pool allow pool state mutations during read operations, potentially causing inconsistent valuations? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/cetus_adaptor.move] [Integration] Can asset_type String be manipulated to point to a different asset than intended, causing value updates to wrong vault entries? (High)
